intro: Bupleurum petiolare, commonly known as the leafy bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. Its root system is fibrous, and it is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
